meanings.definition: A steroid hormone produced by the adrenal cortex.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed hydrocortisone for the patient's adrenal issue.
meanings.sent2: The adrenal glands release hydrocortisone to help the body respond to stress.
meanings.sent3: The adrenal cortex threw a party, and hydrocortisone was the star guest!
meanings.sent4: In the play of hormones, hydrocortisone played the role of the hero, saving the day.
meanings.sent5: Imagine hydrocortisone as a tiny superhero inside your body, fighting off stress villains.

meanings.definition: A synthetic form of cortisol used as a medication to treat inflammation and allergies.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist recommended hydrocortisone cream for the skin rash.
meanings.sent2: Hydrocortisone is commonly used to reduce swelling and itching from insect bites.
meanings.sent3: The allergic reaction was so surprised by hydrocortisone's arrival, it calmed down immediately!
meanings.sent4: Her inflamed skin welcomed hydrocortisone like a soothing balm.
meanings.sent5: The relief brought by hydrocortisone was like a cool breeze on a hot day for the irritated skin.
